intro: Plagiobothrys torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey’s bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in regions such as California and Nevada. Its leaves are deeply lobed, and the flowers are blue to purple in color, with distinctive curling petals. It is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
